title: How to Reset Your Hisense Smart TV

steps.title: Press and hold the "Exit" button for 15 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the "Exit" button for 15 seconds. If you don't see an "Exit" button, use another method with your specified TV. This method will work with any Hisense TV that comes with a remote that has an "Exit" button. A menu will pop up, and you can release the "Exit" button. Select OK when you see the Factory Service menu pop up. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Turn off your TV for at least 20 seconds.
steps.content: Turn off your TV for at least 20 seconds. When you turn it back on, you'll notice that the TV has reverted to factory settings. That means you'll need to re-download any apps or re-configure custom settings.

steps.title: Press and hold the "Reset" button for 15 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the "Reset" button for 15 seconds. It's on the back of your TV. Press the recessed button with a small tool like a toothpick. Release this button when your TV restarts. Once it restarts, it'll be like new. Re-download any apps or set up any custom settings you had previously.

steps.title: Press the "Home" button.
steps.content: Press the "Home" button. This will bring you to the home screen. Alternatively, press the "Reset" button on your TV if there is one.

steps.title: Go to the "Settings" menu.
steps.content: Go to the "Settings" menu. Press the "Down" navigational arrow on your remote to highlight "Settings" and press the "Right" navigational arrow on your remote to enter the menu.

steps.title: Select System.
steps.content: Select System . Press the "Down" navigational arrow on your remote to highlight "System" and press the "Right" navigational arrow on your remote to enter the menu.

steps.title: Select Advanced system settings.
steps.content: Select Advanced system settings . Press the "Down" navigational arrow on your remote to highlight "Advanced system settings," then press the "Right" navigational arrow on your remote to enter the menu. "Factory reset" will immediately be highlighted. You can choose two options: Reset TV audio/picture settings Or Factory reset everything

steps.title: Select Factory reset everything.
steps.content: Select Factory reset everything . Press the "Right" directional button to enter the "Factory Reset" menu and use the "Down" navigational buttons to select the factory reset method.

steps.title: Enter a four-digit code.
steps.content: Enter a four-digit code. The code you need to re-enter is in the box below the keypad, and it changes every time you come to this page. This is a security measure to prevent your TV from accidentally being reset to factory settings. After you enter the code, your TV will restart and be like new when it turns back on. Resetting means deleting all personal data and accounts on the TV and uninstalling any downloaded apps.

steps.title: Press the "Home" button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the "Home" button on your remote. It looks like an icon of a house below the directional pad. Alternatively, press the "Reset" button on your TV if there is one.

steps.title: Navigate to the "Settings" menu.
steps.content: Navigate to the "Settings" menu. Using the directional buttons on your remote, go to the gear icon and select the middle button in the directional pad to open Settings.

steps.title: Select Device Preferences.
steps.content: Select Device Preferences . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Select Reset.
steps.content: Select Reset . It's towards the bottom of a longer menu.

steps.title: Select Reset and Erase everything.
steps.content: Select Reset and Erase everything . This will turn your TV off and reset it to factory settings. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Press the "Home" button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the "Home" button on your remote. It looks like an icon of a house below the directional pad. Alternatively, press the "Reset" button on your TV if there is one.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. Use the "Right" directional button to select the gear icon and press the "OK" button in the center of the directional pad.

steps.title: Select Support.
steps.content: Select Support . It's the last option on the menu.

steps.title: Select Reset to Factory Default.
steps.content: Select Reset to Factory Default . This is the last option on the menu.

steps.title: Enter the System PIN if you set it up.
steps.content: Enter the System PIN if you set it up. Skip this step if you didn't create a System PIN.

steps.title: Select Restore.
steps.content: Select Restore . This will turn it off and revert your TV to factory settings. All your data, accounts, and apps will be erased, and you will need to redo any custom settings. You may need to enter a 4-digit code to confirm your action. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Press the gear button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the gear button on your remote. It's near the top right corner of the remote. Press Enter on your remote to open Settings. Alternatively, press the "Reset" button on your TV if there is one.

steps.title: Select System.
steps.content: Select System . Use the "Down" button to navigate to this menu option, then press the "Right" button to enter the menu.

steps.title: Select About.
steps.content: Select About . Use the "Down" button to navigate to this menu option, then press the "Right" button to enter the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select Reset.
steps.content: Select Reset . Use the "Down" button to navigate to this menu option, then press the "Right" button to enter the menu.

steps.title: Select Factory reset.
steps.content: Select Factory reset . It's the first option on the menu. This will prompt your TV to turn off and erase all your data, settings, accounts, and apps. The "Factory settings" option only resets video and audio settings.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. From the home screen, press the "Right" navigational button to select the gear icon and press "Ok" on your remote. If you have a "Settings" button on your remote, press that to open the Settings menu quickly.

steps.title: Select Device & Software or My Fire TV.
steps.content: Select Device & Software or My Fire TV . The wording here changes depending on your Fire TV OS version.

steps.title: Select Reset to Factory Defaults.
steps.content: Select Reset to Factory Defaults . It's the last option on the menu.

steps.title: Select Reset to confirm.
steps.content: Select Reset to confirm. After you confirm your action, the TV will restart and revert to factory settings. This will delete all your data, apps, and configurations. [5] X Research source
